Description: Blue glazed composition standing figure of Thoth: ibis-headed, wearing a kilt and striated wig. On an integral plinth with the left leg advanced; broken through at waist level and repaired. There is an integral back-pillar.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: J.H. Taylor and N.C. Strudwick, Mummies: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt. Treasures from The British Museum, Santa Ana and London 2005, pp. 106-7, pl. on p. 106.
Bibliographic references: Taylor & Strudwick 2005 / Mummies: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt (p.106-107)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2005-2008, California, The Bowers Museum, Death and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Donated by: Lt-Gen Augustus W H Meyrick
